data.title: Crash when selecting New DynamicFontData and disabling Use Mipmaps
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 7, Godot 3.0

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Godot crashed when I tried to set up a custom font and testing some options (Mipmaps, Filter).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a Button -> Custom Fonts -> New DynamicFont -> New DynamicFontData.
Settings -> Enable and then disable Use Mipmaps.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Missing Icon in the file system dock
data.body:
When the file system dock is in half height mode, and you go into file mode, the button that allows you to go back into tree mode is missing.

editor/filesystem_dock.cpp tries to set it using:
`get_icon("Filesystem", "EditorIcons")`

data.title: Correct GDnative's godot_string_find_last method name
Implement index shifting for physics shapes
data.body:
So that collision pairs always point to the same shape as when they were created. It's achieved by shifting the shape index as needed if others with a lower index are removed and setting -1 for pairs referencing the very removed shape.

Obviously, the -1s are checked where relevant.

This should make physics more stable.

I originally did this for 2.1 (as part of #8999), but I hadn't yet ported it to 3.0 as the need for it wasn't ever confirmed to me. @reduz, what can you tell me now?

data.title: Error when importing svg graphics with mipmaps
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Arch Linux, Godot 3 master https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/a717083235b3369aef9a3846b5071fac023a60b2

**Issue description:**
When I try to import svg graphics with mipmaps enabled, I get the following error messages in the console:

```
to gen mipmaps w 349 h 665 format RGBA8 mipmaps 9 new size is: 1235952
libpng warning: Image width is zero in IHDR
libpng error: Invalid IHDR data
ERROR: _lossless_pack_png: Method/Function Failed, returning: PoolVector<uint8_t>()
   At: drivers/png/image_loader_png.cpp:311.
success
ERROR: _lossless_unpack_png: Condition ' len < 4 ' is true. returned: Ref<Image>()
   At: drivers/png/image_loader_png.cpp:259.
ERROR: _load_data: Condition ' img.is_null() || img->empty() ' is true. returned: ERR_FILE_CORRUPT
   At: scene/resources/texture.cpp:526.
```

Running a project that uses these textures is not possible (game window closes immediately)

data.title: HTML5 build error related to PCRE2
data.body:
Compiling Godot Git https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/a717083235b3369aef9a3846b5071fac023a60b2 fails for the HTML5 (WebAssembly) platform, on an Ubuntu 16.04 host running the latest stable Emscripten version:

```
In file included from thirdparty/pcre2/src/pcre2_jit_compile.c:78:
thirdparty/pcre2/src/sljit/sljitLir.c:1754:49: error: conflicting types for 'sljit_create_compiler'
SLJIT_API_FUNC_ATTRIBUTE struct sljit_compiler* sljit_create_compiler(void)
                                                ^
thirdparty/pcre2/src/sljit/sljitLir.h:424:49: note: previous declaration is here
SLJIT_API_FUNC_ATTRIBUTE struct sljit_compiler* sljit_create_compiler(void *allocator_data);
                                                ^
thirdparty/pcre2/src/pcre2_jit_compile.c:81:2: error: Unsupported architecture
#error Unsupported architecture
 ^
Compiling ==> thirdparty/pcre2/src/pcre2_match.c
In file included from thirdparty/pcre2/src/pcre2_jit_compile.c:11499:
thirdparty/pcre2/src/pcre2_jit_misc.c:113:1: error: implicit declaration of function 'sljit_free_unused_memory_exec' is invalid in C99 [-Werror,-Wimplicit-function-declaration]
sljit_free_unused_memory_exec();
^
3 errors generated.
ERROR:root:compiler frontend failed to generate LLVM bitcode, halting
scons: *** [thirdparty/pcre2/src/pcre2_jit_compile_16.javascript.opt.debug.webassembly.bc] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

According to the error message, this is likely a regression from https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/10148.

some unwanted effects were introduced along with the new white theme

before
![screenshot from 2017-08-31 12-26-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/29936664-a2930e6a-8e48-11e7-924d-072cf3cc8ad1.png)
![screenshot from 2017-08-31 12-26-57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/29936667-a4e625d0-8e48-11e7-92f4-6ba2f64dcbc4.png)


after
![screenshot from 2017-08-31 12-32-51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/29936680-abde96ec-8e48-11e7-9641-4e3c088fcf06.png)

1.  of all most of the elements are bigger now, this is unwanted, it actually even though this does not look that bad, it reduces the number of element in lists (at least should be configurable).

2. buttons are brighter

3. Inputs do not have borders even though my settings are set to have 1px border.

@toger5 this is the problem with including sneaky changes, next time it would be better to include such changes on different PRs

im not sure if there are other changes like that, but please @toger5 try to not include sneaky changes, i spend quite some work making sure that metric are correct and colors are not very odd, and including this changes would make me repeat my changes (which is not fun).


**Steps to reproduce:**

data.title: Create a tool for adding documentation
data.body:
It would be amazing to have a tool to document godot.
I'm imaging an xml parser which than gives me a list of all classes and documentable item.
I can than just type in whatever is approprite to describe something. It changes the xml and saves it.
I can commit and done.
So no user errors when editing the xml and no fighting with the size of the file.

## web app
it could be a web app with the advantage, that it is accessible to everyone.
Te server could handle:
 1. Compiling godot for the docs tool (every second day)
 2. than updating the class reference.
 3. opening pr's for the newly added documentation (also every second day)

everyone could go to the website an edit the docs with all the new (introduced two days ago) functions and params.


## an app created with godot.
 1. that also would be cool and easier to do.
 2. it would be a project made with godot just to edit the xml file
 3. all updating + committing + creating pr would still be handled by the user...

## It could be build into the editor!
the editor could have the option to edit the docs right inside of it. (only works when connected to internet) than a http request would be made and a server would handle the rest (creating pr...)
If no internet connection is provided the editor could have the option to create a classes.xml so users can create the pr themselves.

data.title: changed-"HSlider" -> "VSlider" for focus style fixes #728
Fix inconsistent toggle button behavior
data.body:
Fixes #10759.

I moved the `emit_signal("toggled", status.pressed)` after the call to the script instance so that the script is invoked before the signal is emitted, since this is the case for the "pressed" case as well. (It probably doesn't matter in most cases.)

Currently the call to `_unpress_group_` is handled slightly differently in the `ACTION_MODE_BUTTON_PRESS` and `ACTION_MODE_BUTTON_RELEASE` cases. Since I'm not sure if there is a reason why this was done differently (in lines 84 vs. 92, and in 152) I've left this unchanged. Perhaps it would make sense to insert `_unpress_group_()` in line 100 and remove the calls in lines 84 and 92.

data.title: Fix import dock "Set as default" actions
data.body:
## **Pull Request Description:**

This PR fixes importer dock "Set as default" and other related actions functionality. It ensures that when clicking this button, the currently edited importer properties get saved as the importer defaults.

## **Steps to reproduce:**

1. Open Godot editor v3.0.alpha.build1.
2. Select an importable asset from the FileSystem dock.
3. Navigate to the "Import" dock tab.
4. Modify any of the importer properties.
5. Click on "Preset > Set as default for 'type'".

**Results:** Modified importer properties get reset to their original (default) values.
**Expected Results:** Modified importer properties get saved as the global default properties for the importer type.

---

I believe there's still work to be done in the importer process, since re-importing assets doesn't apply this previously saved configurations. I'll confirm this and either create a new issue or try and find a fix and create a new PR.

data.title: Failed to compile godot source to an android export template
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10 Pro, Godot 2.1.3-stable

**Issue description:**
I typed this to compile godot : scons platform=android target=release, but then this error pops out:
```
scons: Reading SConscript files ...

MSVC not detected, attempting Mingw.
- gcc detected.
Godot Android!!!!! (armv7) (with neon)
scons: done reading SConscript files.
scons: Building targets ...
C:\Program Files (x86)\Android\android-ndk-r13b/toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/windows-x86_64/bin/clang++ -o platform\android\os_android.os -c -fno-rtti -fno-exceptions -DNO_SAFE_CAST -Wall -DNDEBUG -DFREETYPE_ENABLED -DENABLE_DEPRECATED -isystem "C:\Program Files (x86)\Android\android-ndk-r13b/platforms/android-14/arch-arm/usr/include" -fpic -ffunction-sections -funwind-tables -fstack-protector-strong -fvisibility=hidden -fno-strict-aliasing -DANDROID -DNO_STATVFS -DGLES2_ENABLED -D__ARM_ARCH_7__ -D__ARM_ARCH_7A__ -march=armv7-a -mfloat-abi=softfp -mfpu=neon -D__ARM_NEON__ -target armv7-none-linux-androideabi -fno-integrated-as -gcc-toolchain "C:\Program Files (x86)\Android\android-ndk-r13b/toolchains/arm-linux-androideabi-4.9/prebuilt/windows-x86_64" -O2 -DNDEBUG -ffast-math -funsafe-math-optimizations -fomit-frame-pointer -ftree-vectorize -DANDROID_ENABLED -DUNIX_ENABLED -DNO_FCNTL -DMPC_FIXED_POINT -DGDSCRIPT_ENABLED -DMINIZIP_ENABLED -DXML_ENABLED -Icore -Icore\math -Ieditor -Idrivers -I. -Iplatform\android -Ithirdparty\zlib -Ithirdparty\freetype -Ithirdparty\freetype\include -Ithirdparty\libpng platform\android\os_android.cpp
scons: *** [platform\android\os_android.os] The system cannot find the file specified
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```
I've seen many of these, but none of them really helped me. I've changed the folder 'windows' in android-ndk to 'windows-x86_64' and 'windows-x86' but still the same problem. I also run the cmd as an admin. Is there anyone that can help me with this problem?

data.title: Fixed incorrect KinematicBody::_move normal return
data.body: Previously, the dictionary returned by KinematicBody::_move had an incorrect normal. Instead, the normal was a copy of the collision position.

data.title: Add Support for Geometry Shaders
data.body:
they are part of specification from OpenGL 3.2, so would be fine to add them to godot?

they will allow to make some geometry complexity modifications (because tessellation shaders aren't available for us, because they are OpenGL 4 feature), they will allow creating good grass on the fly, trees, fur. controlling LODs from the shader itself. and some people even create performant voxel engines using them.

and last but not least, it will allow to recalculate normals on the mesh that was changed by vertex shader.

data.title: unified draw_center naming for (9patch,StyleBoxes)
data.body:
- filled -> draw_center
 - is_draw_center -> is_draw_center_enabled
 - get_draw_center -> is_draw_center_enabled

@akien-mga the renaming discussed on irc.
